intro: Heteropterys laurentii, commonly known as the Mexican mahogany, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Mexico and Central America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its large, simple leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces woody fruits that contain several seeds, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The tree can reach heights of up to 20 meters and has a slow growth rate.
